{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3283130,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-13T14:09:30.624Z","cooked":"

With the flexibility of the gamepiece you can feed it through a pretty small turret ring. Who’s gonna give it a try? I am sure someone will, irrelevant of the drivetrain underneath…

Our robot is already on four tiny turrets. I think that’s sufficient!

It may be helpful at extremely high levels for hoarding strategies but other then that, I honestly don’t see too much value especially since you can only hold one note at a time.

we look to be going down the path of the coveted turreted bumper

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-01-13T14:28:53.104Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":821,"readers_count":820,"score":164.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":449864,"topic_slug":"whos-tossing-a-turret-on-this-thing","display_username":"Silas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51263,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/whos-tossing-a-turret-on-this-thing/449864/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3283182,"name":"","username":"Ray4362","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ray4362/{size}/186140_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-13T15:11:34.535Z","cooked":"

My reasons for not doing a turret this year:

  1. The speaker is very wide and can only be scored from one direction. As long as your robot is facing the right direction, the turret will only be saving a moment of spinning/driving at best. We also experienced in 2022 that in-match turrets often took more time to calibrate and occasionally just didn’t want to work (limelight got distracted).

  2. Turrets improve shooting time, but since there is a one game piece limit, the shooting time is minimal; there isn’t much time to cut off.

  3. I don’t think it makes much sense with the flip intake like cranberry alarm has, especially if you want a short robot.

  4. It’s more complicated, takes more time, more weight…

The perfect Crescendo robot would have a turret. There will be some good teams cook up an insane turret design, and I’ll think “wow, we should’ve done that.” However, most teams that have six weeks to build a robot will have different priorities.

It would probably be a huge waste of time, especially for teams like mine who have limited weeks. We’re instead using a moving appendage that picks up notes and deposits them in the amp.

We’re considering it heavily right now for a few strategy reasons. I don’t think it will see a ton of use however so it’s lower on the design list after we complete the under bumper intake and a solid shooter that can also do amp scoring.
